column5: Lily of the Valley,  pick the flowers and place in a small shot glass with water, very nice smell.
Yes , definitely Lily of the Valley, it can be invasive spreading underground by runners, I'm still trying to get rid of some because of the dogs as it is poisonous.
Very nice lily of the valley. I have them planted on the farm they smell fantastic when blooming. Ther than that they are a green leafy plant that spreads underground.   art
Thanks guys. I I have them in the back yard and yes they spread like crazy.
I have them too.  I have seen dogs eat grass, but none of my dogs, or any visiting dogs, have ever shown any interest in these plants.

Our neighbor's cat is no longer with us, after it decided to taste the lilly's in our back yard.  Pretty sad really, it was only a couple of minutes after it ate the plant; that the cat was on its side paddling with foam coming out of its mouth. The cat only lasted an hour or so after getting it to the vet.  Dan.
